newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt pound interbank rates rise in short market.
newsitem.headline: Egypt pound interbank rates rise in short market.

text.p: Overnight interbank rates on the Egyptian pound rose on Sunday in a short private sector market to between 8-1/2 and 8-3/4 percent from a range of seven and 8-3/4 percent on Thursday, bankers said.
The market is normally short on Sundays, the first trading day of the working week.
Many bankers said they did not make any one-week deals. Two bankers quoted rates of between 8-3/4 and nine percent, higher than Thursday's range of between 7-3/4 and 8-1/2 percent.
The bankers said public-sector banks kept their official minimum lending rate steady at 10-1/2 percent.
